subject: UK PM May was said to be pressured by cabinet ministers last night to drop cross party Brexit talks and launch a final attempt to reach a compromise in parliament, according to The Times
PRE-MARKET AUSTRALIAN, JAPANESE AND SOUTH KOREAN STOCK NEWS: Earnings including CBA, Mitsui & Co., NTT, Rakuten and Suzuki
content:
AUSTRALIA

Adelaide Brighton (ABC AT) - Co. extends cement supply contract with Oz Minerals (OZL AT). (Newswires)

APA Group (APA AT) - Co. named Rob Wheals as new CEO effective July 5th. (Newswires)

AusNet Services (AST AT) - Co. FY net AUD 253.9mln vs. Prev. AUD 291.4mln. (Newswires)

Commonwealth Bank of Australia (CBA AT) - Co. Q3 cash profit AUD 1.70bln vs. Prev. AUD 2.35bln Y/Y, notes that its troublesome and impaired assets rose to AUD 7.2bln. (Newswires)

Eclipx Group (ECX AT) - Co. guides H1 non-cash impairment charges of AUD 110mln-130mln, names Julian Russel as CEO and will sell its Australian commercial equipment financing business. (Newswires)

Fonterra (FSF AT) - Co. confirms it is to sell Tip Top business for NZD 380mln. (Newswires)

GrainCorp (GNC AT) - ANZ Terminal proposes to divest its Adelaide site to get approval to acquire GrainCorpâ€™s Australian Bulk Liquid Terminals business. (Newswires)

Medusa Mining (MML AT) - Co. raised its gold output guidance to 98k-105k ounces from 90k-100k ounces. (Newswires)

News Corp (NWS AT) - Co. is considering interest in Asia for Foxtel refinancing. (AFR)

Reliance Worldwide (RWC AT) - Co. cuts FY19 EBITDA guidance to AUD 260mln-270mln from AUD 280mln-290mln. (Newswires)

Vicinity Centres (VCX AT) - SCE Property Group and Charter Hall Retal are said to be considering a takeover of the Co. (Newswires)

 

JAPAN

Leopalace21 (8848 JT) - Co. FY net loss JPY 68.7bln vs. Prev. profit JPY 14.8bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Mitsui & Co. (8031 JT) - Co. FY net JPY 169bln vs. Prev. JPY 156bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

NTT (9432 JT) - Co. FY net JPY 855bln vs. Prev. JPY 898bln Y/Y, rev. JPY 11.9tln vs. Prev. JPY 11.8tln Y/Y, to buyback JPY 250bln of shares. (Newswires)

Rakuten (4755 JT) - Co. Q1 net JPY 105bln vs. Prev. JPY 17.4bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Shizuoka Bank (8355 JT) - Co. will repurchase and retire 1.7% of shares for JPY 10bln. (Newswires)

SoftBank (9984 JT) - Co. Vision Fund takes USD 800mln stake in Greensill. (Newswires)

Suzuki Motor (7269 JT) - Co. FY net JPY 179bln vs. Prev. JPY 216bln Y/Y, rev. JPY 3.9tln vs. Prev. JPY 3.8tln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Earnings - Japan's publicly traded businesses reportedly experienced a 2% decline in net profit for the financial year. (Nikkei)

Other News - US reportedly sought a quick agreement with Japan on a bilateral trade deal in a phone call between US Trade Representative Lighthizer and Japanese Economy Minister Motegi. (Newswires)

 

SOUTH KOREA

Shinsegae (004170 KS) - Co. Q1 net KRW 685.8bln vs. Prev. KRW 84.2bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

SKC (011790 KS) - Co. oper. profit KRW 36.2bln vs. Prev. KRW 41.2bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

subject: US President Trump tweets "China is DREAMING that Sleepy Joe Biden, or any of the others, gets elected in 2020. They LOVE ripping off America!"
South Korea Vice Finance Minister says exports will improve from chip sector recovery

ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights include Australia Home Loans and New Zealand Food Prices
South Africa's ruling ANC Party remains in power with 57.5% of vote vs. 62% in 2014
UK opposition Labour party trade policy chief Gardiner says biggest sticking point is uncertainty PM May's successor will deliver on deal negotiated with government
Chinese press People's Daily accuses US of obstructing progress on bilateral trade talks

US equity futures reopen for the week with heavy losses amid ongoing US-China trade uncertainty and with President Trump warning that that a deal will become far worse for China if it is negotiated during his 2nd term; Emini S&P -0.8%, Dow futures (-0.7%)
UK PM May could reportedly be asked to step down this week, according to UK press
DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
ASIA-PAC

US President Trump tweeted that talks with China continue in a very congenial manner, while he also suggested that there is absolutely no need to rush and the process has begun to place additional tariffs at 25% on the remaining USD 325bln of Chinese goods. Furthermore, President Trump suggested that he thinks China felt they were being beaten so badly on negotiations that they may as well wait around for next election, but warned that a deal will become far worse for them if it is negotiated during his second term and that it would be wise for China to act now but he loves collecting big tariffs. (Twitter)

White House economic adviser Kudlow said China has invited US Treasury Secretary Mnuchin and Trade representative Lighthizer to China to continue trade talks, while he also suggested that it is US importers that are paying for the tariffs instead of China and that both sides will lose in the trade war. (Newswires/Fox)

China Vice Premier Liu He said trade talks with the US went "fairly well". Furthermore, Global Times Editor Hu Xijin said US/China trade talks have not broken down and that both sides see the talks as constructive, while Hu added that consultations will continue and both sides agreed to meet again in Beijing in the future. (Newswires)

US and China trade negotiators are said to be at odds on 3 major issues including disagreement on removal of all remaining tariffs, differences in wording of the agreement and with China said to view US import targets as unrealistic. In related news, the US reportedly gave China their bottom line in which China now have 3-4 weeks to react before more tariffs will be raised on the remaining USD 325bln of Chinese imports, according to Bloomberg's Jennifer Jacobs. (Xinhua/Twitter)

PBoC said it will use structural policy tools including targeted MLF, re-lending and re-discount to support private and small firms, while it reiterated that monetary policy is to remain prudent. (Newswires)

  • Indian Industrial Output (Mar) Y/Y -0.1% vs. Exp. 1.3% (Prev. 0.1%)
  • Indian Manufacturing Output (Mar) -0.4% (Prev. -0.3%, Rev. -0.4%))

 

UK/EU

UK PM May is meeting with the 1922 committee on Thursday in which she is expected to provide a clear road map for standing down as leader. In other news, UK PM May is reportedly promising to reopen Brexit talks with the EU in an attempt to breathe life back into negotiations with the opposition Labour Party and take UK out of EU by the summer. (Newswires)

UK Brexit Secretary Barclay seeks to ramp up preparations for abrupt exit before 31st October. (FT)

UK Shadow Brexit Secretary Starmer is pessimistic on passing a cross-party Brexit deal which lacked a confirmatory referendum and stated that as many as 150 Labour MPs would reject a deal which didnâ€™t include a confirmatory referendum. (Guardian)

  • UK GDP (Q1 P) Q/Q 0.5% vs. Exp. 0.5% (Prev. 0.2%)
  • UK GDP (Q1 P) Y/Y 1.8% vs. Exp. 1.8% (Prev. 1.4%)
  • UK Manufacturing Output (Mar) M/M 0.9% vs. Exp. 0.2% (Prev. 0.9%, Rev. 1.0%)

 

FX

  • Canadian Employment Change (Apr) 106.5k vs. Exp. 10.0k (Prev. -7.2k). (Newswires)
  • Canadian Unemployment Rate (Apr) 5.7% vs. Exp. 5.8% (Prev. 5.8%)

 

COMMODITIES 

Houston ship channel was closed following a collision of ships. (Newswires) 

 

GEOPOLITICS

US Acting Defense Secretary Shanahan approved new deployment of patriot missiles to Middle East over Iran concerns. (Newswires) 

 

US

Fed's Williams (Voter, Neutral) said there are reasons to believe that the surge in growth will not persist and stated that nflation data is softer than expected but appears to reflect normal volatility in figures. Furthermore, Williams said return to 2% inflation should supported by labour market and US economy, while he suggested that they need to sustain the expansion. (Newswires)

Fed's Bostic (Non-voter, Dove) said the US is at, or very close to the Fed's inflation target and noted that US economy is doing very well. (Newswires)

US House Ways and Means Committee Chair Neal issued subpoenas to US Treasury Secretary Mnuchin and IRS Commissioner Retting for the release of President Trumpâ€™s tax returns. (Newswires)

  • US CPI (Apr) M/M 0.3% vs. Exp. 0.4% (Prev. 0.4%)
  • US CPI (Apr) Y/Y 2.0% vs. Exp. 2.1% (Prev. 1.9%)

 

MARKET RECAP

Walmart (WMT) moved higher at the open as Cleveland Research reported positively on the co. Ford (F) caught a bid on an upgrade from Bank of America, which said that earnings are at a favourable inflexion point given the automakers restructuring efforts. JD.com (JD) opened higher after reporting better than expected earnings on both the top and bottom lines. Marriott International (MAR) shares were under pressure after reporting weak earnings and lowered guidance. More widely, Hotels chains including Hyatt (H), Marriott (MAR) and online booking co Expedia (EPXE), were all under pressure after US state attorneys opened an investigation into alleged antitrust violations. Kinder Morgan (KMI) fell as the energy co announced its decision to remain as a stand-alone public entity. Symantecâ€™s (SYMC) share price tumbled after the software co reduced its guidance in its latest earnings release. Dropbox (DPX) opened higher after reporting strong earnings, but did pare gains throughout the session as the wider tech sector fell. Uber (UBER) underwent its first day of public trading, falling slightly beneath its target range. S&P 500 0.4% at 2882, NASDAQ-100 0.1% at 7587, Dow Jones 0.5% at 25945.

At settlement, Treasuries were more-or-less unchanged on the session, with gains being pared after constructive comments from US Treasury Secretary Mnuchin on talks with the Chinese, while Chinaâ€™s officials also sounded a constructive tone, and said the sides would meet in Beijing in the coming weeks. The complex was a function of sentiment on trade, often whipsawed by tweets from the US President, as well as China press. The positive sentiment unwind gains that the TPLEX made on Friday â€“ there was some buying in wake of a the April CPI data, which did not show any signs of â€˜transitoryâ€™ weakness. Nevertheless, on the week, 10-year yields have slipped by 8bps, the sharpest weekly fall in seven weeks. At settlement, major curve spreads were a touch steeper. US T-notes (M9) futures settled unchanged at 123-31+.

subject: US President Trump tweets we are right where we want to be with China....
content: Says... "Remember, they broke the deal with us & tried to renegotiate. We will be taking in Tens of Billions of Dollars in Tariffs from China. Buyers of product can make it themselves in the USA (ideal), or buy it from non-Tariffed countries.....We will then spend (match or better) the money that China may no longer be spending with our Great Patriot Farmers (Agriculture), which is a small percentage of total Tariffs received, and distribute the food to starving people in nations around the world! GREAT!  #MAGA"

subject: ASIA-PAC SERVICE IS NOW LIVE FOR TODAY'S SESSION
